main event: Patrolman Lonnie Zamora reported observing an oval-shaped object land in the desert near Socorro, New Mexico, on April 24, 1964, and saw two humanoid figures emerge before the object took off rapidly.
interesting points: The object was oval-shaped, approximately 15 to 20 feet long and 7 to 8 feet high, with red lettering on its side., Zamora described the object having a blue flame underneath when it rose., The sighting led to nationwide publicity, marking it as one of the most significant UFO incidents., Scorched vegetation and deep impressions were found at the landing site, indicating physical evidence of the landing., Various other witnesses, including police officers Sergeant Samuel Chavez and Patrolman Leonard Foster, corroborated Zamora's account.
witness description: Lonnie Zamora, Police Officer from Socorro; Sergeant Samuel Chavez; Patrolman Leonard Foster
